definition[0]: a short period of time during which you fail to do something well or properly, often caused by not being careful
example[0]: A defensive lapse by Keown allowed Tottenham to score.
example[1]: Despite the occasional lapse, this was a fine performance by the young saxophonist.
example[3]: A single lapse of concentration cost Sampras the game.
example[5]: After taking the drug, several patients suffered memory lapses  (=when you cannot remember something for a short time).
definition[1]: a failure to do something you should do, especially to behave correctly
example[6]: He forgot to offer Darren a drink, but Marie did not appear to notice the lapse.
definition[2]: a period of time between two events
example[7]: The usual time lapse between request and delivery is two days.
example[8]: a lapse of about ten seconds
definition[3]: to gradually come to an end or to stop for a period of time
definition[4]: if a contract, agreement etc lapses, it comes to an end, usually because an agreed time limit has passed
example[10]: Your booking will automatically lapse unless you confirm it.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say that a contract or agreement runs out rather than lapses:
example[11]: His club membership had run out.
definition[5]: to stop believing in or following a religion
example[12]: those people who have lapsed from the practice of their religion
definition[6]: if a period of time lapses, it passes
example[13]: Many years had lapsed since her first visit to Wexford.
definition[7]: if a contract, agreement, or offer lapses, it ends because an agreed time limit has passed
example[14]: The customer has the right to exercise the option or allow the option to lapse.
example[15]: There are many films on which the copyright has lapsed and hasn’t been renewed.
definition[8]: if an INSURANCE POLICY lapses, it ends because the regular payments required have not been made
example[16]: Kimble let his fire insurance lapse when he couldn’t afford the premiums.
example[17]: There is a four-day lapse between the time a patron buys a ticket and the money is deposited in the bank.
definition[9]: a failure to do something you should do
example[18]: The customer complained about a lapse in service.
